greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 2^n mod 7.
comment: Periodic sequence with period [1,2,4]. - _Philippe Deléham_, Sep 25 2006
a(n) = cubefree part of 2^n. - _Artur Jasinski_, Oct 15 2008
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,1).
maple: A069705 := proc(n) op((n mod 3)+1,[1,2,4]) ; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 05 2011
mathematica: PowerMod[2,Range[0,110],7] (* or *) PadRight[{},110,{1,2,4}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 28 2015 *)
program: (Sage) [power_mod(2,n,7) for n in range(0, 105)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 07 2009
xref: Cf. A178233 (decimal expansion of (11+sqrt(229))/18). - _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 23 2010
Appears in A179132. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jul 01 2010
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Jan 14 2003
